Interface IEnvironmentSingle

All Superinterfaces:

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractEnvironmentSingle, AbstractMember, AbstractMemberV2, Acrobot, AcrobotCLS2, AcrobotCLS2Tiling, AcrobotCLS2TilingSimple, AliceMaze, AliceMazeContinuousDistance, AliceMazeDistance, ArmN, ArmNV2, Brazzaville, CarRental, Circuit, CircularCircuit, Congo, ElementaryMultiAgentEnvironment, ElementaryMuscleEnvironment, ElementaryMuscleEnvironmentV2, ElementaryMuscleTiling, GamblerGame, LocalVisionMaze, Maze, MountainCar, MountainCarTiling, MountainCarTilingH, Pinball
public interface IEnvironmentSingle
extends IEnvironment

Author:
Francesco De Comite The definition of Environment for non-adversial environments : the next state depends only of the preceeding one and the action taken. Also holds for multi-agent (cooperative) schemes The difference with environment for two players is mainly that there is no notion of winner.
